description.zh-cn: 明末清初的政治家与军事家，是明清朝代更替中的关键人物。他原为明朝将领，镇守山海关，后投降清朝，被封为平西王。在康熙年间，他发动了三藩之乱，并建立了吴周政权，自立为帝。
description.en: A political and military figure in the late Ming and early Qing dynasties, a key player in the Ming-Qing transition. Originally a Ming general guarding Shanhai Pass, he surrendered to the Qing dynasty and was made the Prince Who Pacifies the West. During the Kangxi era, he initiated the Revolt of the Three Feudatories, established the Wu Zhou regime, and proclaimed himself emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明朝锦州总兵，吴三桂之父。
description.en: A Ming dynasty military commander of Jinzhou and the father of Wu Sangui.

description.zh-cn: 明末将领，吴三桂的舅舅。
description.en: A general in the late Ming dynasty and the maternal uncle of Wu Sangui.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上的一个朝代，由朱元璋建立。
description.en: A dynasty in Chinese history founded by Zhu Yuanzhang.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上的最后一个皇朝，由满族建立。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty in Chinese history, established by the Manchu people.

description.zh-cn: 明朝的末代皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Ming dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 明末农民起义领袖，建立了大顺政权。
description.en: A peasant rebel leader in the late Ming dynasty who founded the Shun dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清朝初年的摄政王，清世祖顺治帝的叔父，清军入关的实际指挥者。
description.en: A regent in the early Qing dynasty, uncle of the Shunzhi Emperor, and the de facto commander of the Qing forces that conquered China proper.

description.zh-cn: 1644年清军在吴三桂的引导下进入山海关，随后占领北京并逐步统一中国的历史事件。
description.en: The historical event in 1644 where Qing forces, guided by Wu Sangui, entered Shanhai Pass, subsequently occupied Beijing, and gradually unified China.

description.zh-cn: 南明政权的最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Southern Ming regime.

description.zh-cn: 清朝康熙年间，由吴三桂等三位藩王发动的反清叛乱。
description.en: An anti-Qing rebellion during the Kangxi era of the Qing dynasty, led by three feudatory princes including Wu Sangui.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第四位皇帝，年号康熙。
description.en: The fourth emperor of the Qing dynasty, with the era name Kangxi.

description.zh-cn: 三藩之乱期间由吴三桂建立的政权。
description.en: A regime established by Wu Sangui during the Revolt of the Three Feudatories.

description.zh-cn: 吴三桂长子，因三藩之乱被清廷处死。
description.en: The eldest son of Wu Sangui, executed by the Qing court due to the Revolt of the Three Feudatories.

description.zh-cn: 吴三桂之孙，吴应熊之子，与父一同被清廷处死。
description.en: Grandson of Wu Sangui and son of Wu Yingxiong, executed by the Qing court along with his father.

description.zh-cn: 吴三桂的妻子，吴应熊的生母。吴三桂称帝后，被立为皇后。
description.en: Wife of Wu Sangui and biological mother of Wu Yingxiong. She was proclaimed empress after Wu Sangui declared himself emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明末清初“秦淮八艳”之一，吴三桂的爱妾。
description.en: One of the "Eight Beauties of Qinhuai" in the late Ming and early Qing dynasties, and the beloved concubine of Wu Sangui.

description.zh-cn: 吴三桂之孙，吴周政权的第二位也是最后一位皇帝。
description.en: Grandson of Wu Sangui, the second and last emperor of the Wu Zhou regime.

description.zh-cn: 缅甸东吁王朝国王，将永历帝献给吴三桂。
description.en: King of the Toungoo dynasty of Burma, who handed over the Yongli Emperor to Wu Sangui.

description.zh-cn: 明末清初诗人、学者，因创作讽刺吴三桂的《圆圆曲》而闻名。
description.en: A poet and scholar of the late Ming and early Qing dynasties, famous for writing "The Song of Yuanyuan," which satirized Wu Sangui.

description.zh-cn: 由吴伟业创作的七言长诗，讽刺吴三桂因爱妾陈圆圆而降清的行为。
description.en: A long seven-character poem by Wu Weiye that satirizes Wu Sangui's surrender to the Qing, attributing it to his love for his concubine Chen Yuanyuan.

description.zh-cn: 吴三桂是祖大寿的外甥。
description.en: Wu Sangui was the nephew of Zu Dashou.

position.en: General of Liaodong, Earl who Pacifies the West

description.zh-cn: 任命吴三桂为平西伯，并命令其率军入卫京师。
description.en: Appointed Wu Sangui as the Earl who Pacifies the West and ordered him to lead his troops to defend the capital.

description.zh-cn: 李自成的大顺军攻入北京，后来杀害了吴三桂在北京的全家，成为吴三桂与清军联合的催化剂之一。
description.en: Li Zicheng's Shun army captured Beijing and later executed Wu Sangui's entire family in the city, which became a catalyst for Wu's alliance with the Qing forces.

description.zh-cn: 向多尔衮“泣血求助”，请求清军入关共同对抗李自成的大顺军。
description.en: Sought help from Dorgon, pleading for Qing forces to enter Shanhai Pass to jointly fight against Li Zicheng's Shun army.

description.zh-cn: 吴三桂打开山海关，引导清军进入中原。
description.en: Wu Sangui opened Shanhai Pass, guiding the Qing army into the Central Plains.

description.zh-cn: 在一片石战役中联合清军击溃李自成的大顺军。
description.en: In the Battle of Shanhai Pass, he allied with Qing forces to defeat Li Zicheng's Shun army.

description.zh-cn: 在昆明用弓弦绞死了南明永历帝朱由榔及其子。
description.en: Strangled the Southern Ming Yongli Emperor, Zhu Youlang, and his son with a bowstring in Kunming.

description.zh-cn: 将南明永历帝朱由榔献给吴三桂，为吴三桂处死永历帝创造了条件。
description.en: Handed over the Southern Ming Yongli Emperor, Zhu Youlang, to Wu Sangui, which enabled Wu to execute him.

description.zh-cn: 商议并决定撤藩，成为三藩之乱的直接导火索。
description.en: Discussed and decided to abolish the feudatories, which became the direct trigger for the Revolt of the Three Feudatories.

description.zh-cn: 因不满撤藩，在云南举兵反清，发动三藩之乱。
description.en: Dissatisfied with the abolition of the feudatories, he raised an army in Yunnan against the Qing, initiating the Revolt of the Three Feudatories.

description.zh-cn: 吴世璠是吴三桂的孙子。
description.en: Wu Shifan was the grandson of Wu Sangui.

description.zh-cn: 因吴三桂发动三藩之乱，清廷将作为人质的吴应熊及其子吴世霖绞死。
description.en: Because Wu Sangui initiated the Revolt of the Three Feudatories, the Qing court executed Wu Yingxiong, who was a hostage, and his son Wu Shilin by strangulation.

description.zh-cn: 因其祖父吴三桂发动三藩之乱，与父亲吴应熊一同被清廷绞死。
description.en: Due to his grandfather Wu Sangui's Revolt of the Three Feudatories, he was executed by strangulation along with his father Wu Yingxiong by the Qing court.

description.zh-cn: 创作了长诗《圆圆曲》。
description.en: Authored the long poem "The Song of Yuanyuan".

description.zh-cn: 诗中讽刺并抨击吴三桂“冲冠一怒为红颜”的行为，损害其声誉。
description.en: The poem satirizes and criticizes Wu Sangui's act of "raising his banner in a fury for a beauty," damaging his reputation.
